definition: erhua variant of 早班[zao3 ban1]

sentences.english: Yesterday morning Yang Cheng got up early, so that she caught the first bus.
sentences.chinese: 昨天早上楊成起牀很早，因此，她趕上了早班車。

sentences.english: Hurry up, or you'll miss the early bus.
sentences.chinese: 趕快，否則你就趕不上早班車。

sentences.english: She missed the early bus so she was late for school.
sentences.chinese: 她沒趕上早班車，所以上學遲到了。

sentences.english: She got up late and failed to catch the early bus.
sentences.chinese: 她起晚了，沒能趕上早班車。

sentences.english: The judge sat in the dining-room amid his morning mail.
sentences.chinese: 法官坐在餐廳裏處理一大堆早班郵件。

sentences.english: We had hoped to catch the early bus, but found it was gone.
sentences.chinese: 我們本來希望乘早班車，卻發現車已開了。

sentences.english: To catch the early bus, he got up very early.
sentences.chinese: 爲了趕早班車，他起得很早。

sentences.english: Early morning departure of 2am on Mondays and Tuesdays only.
sentences.chinese: 只有每週一和週二纔有凌晨2點的早班車。

sentences.english: The early train has been discontinued.
He got up early so as to catch the early bus.
sentences.chinese: 爲了能趕上早班車，他起的很早。

sentences.english: Karma today deserves a morning shift change the first night shift.
sentences.chinese: 今日糸早班轉中班噶第一晚。

sentences.english: Look at that." A servant had just come in with the morning mail, a great mass of letters and magazines.
sentences.chinese: 一個僕役剛送來了早班郵件，一大抱信件和雜誌。

sentences.english: My son is always in a hurry to catch the morning bus.
sentences.chinese: 我兒子總是匆匆忙忙趕早班車。

sentences.english: He got up late yesterday morning. So he missed the early bus.
sentences.chinese: 昨天早上他起牀晚了，因此他沒趕上早班車。

sentences.english: Mr. and Mrs. Wang left on the early morning plane to California.
sentences.chinese: 王先生夫婦乘早班飛機到加州。

sentences.english: Get up quickly or you will miss the early bus.
sentences.chinese: 快點兒起牀，否則你就會錯過早班車了。

definition: to change shifts/to work in turns
grade/class number (in school)/flight or run number/flight or run (seen as an item)/shift (work period)
to act as substitute/to fill in for sb
to finish work/to get off work
to hand over to the next workshift
departure (of a coach or train)/to dispatch a vehicle
to arrange (shifts, runs, classes etc) in order
time of going to work/the morning rush hour
